Welcome to our open day and to Aberystwyth University

It isn’t always easy to decide what you want to study and where to go to university but we hope you will find everything you need during our Open Day, to help you with that choice. If you need any further help please get in touch with a staff member in our Admissions Office or in the relevant department, and they will be glad to assist

Aberystwyth is a well-established university with a long tradition of academic excellence, but it is also very forward looking. We’re small enough to be friendly and to allow contact across departments, but big enough to have a wide range of study programmes in the Sciences, the Arts and the Social Sciences, in professional and vocational subjects.

Aberystwyth is a vibrant university town in a stunning coastal location, with a dynamic social and cultural life centred around the University. There’s a tremendous range of opportunities for sports, societies, activities and volunteering available to you here.

In The Event Of An Emergency

Please contact the nearest member of staff immediately. Instructions in case of fire are posted in every building, but if they are not to hand then please vacate the building by the nearest exit, do not use the lifts, and remain outside until informed by a member of University staff that it is safe to re-enter.
In the interests of your own safety, please do not touch any materials or apparatus unless specifically invited to do so by a member of staff.
The University is frequently upgrading and improving facilities for students and consequently there is some building work taking place on the Penglais Campus. We apologise for any inconvienence.

Aberystwyth is easily accessible by road. Whichever way you\'re approaching from you will experience beautiful scenery. From the east the A44 climbs through the Cambrian Hills and down to the coast, and from the north or south the A487 offers spectacular views over Cardigan Bay.
Penglais Campus: SY23 3BY Llanbadarn Campus: SY23 3AS Gogerddan Campus: SY23 3EB\n Old College: SY23 2AY

There are regular train services to Aberystwyth from north Wales and the Midlands (travelling from the east all services pass through Shrewsbury). Please refer to the National Rail Enquiries web site for train times and route options.
There are regular Mid Wales Travel buses between Aberystwyth and all three University campuses.
03 Bus Service \n301 Bus Service \n302 Bus Service

Student-led Campus tours (available through the medium of English or Welsh), lasting approximately 45-60 minutes. Tours start from the concourse area in front of the Arts Centre at:\n \n 10.00am, 11.00am, 12.00pm, 1.00pm, 2.00pm and 3.00pm

Guided tours of the following locations are available every half hour from 10am, the last tour departing at 4.30pm:\n \n Penbryn, Pentre Jane Morgan, Fferm Penglais, Seafront Residences, Welsh Medium Accommodation
Tours leave the Library Enquiry Desk at 10.30am, 2.00pm & 3.00pm and last approximately 20 minutes

Student officer-led tours, lasting approximately 15 minutes, will start from the Students’ Union main entrance at:
 9.30am, 10.00am, 10.30am, 11.00am, 12.00pm, 1.00pm, 1.30pm, 2.00pm, 2.30pm and 3.00pm.
 
 Please call at reception for a tour of the building and the chance to find out more about student life at Aberystwyth.
Fill out the field below to send an email to our team. This will use your phones email app

Here at Aberystwyth we pride ourselves on our student experience. The following buttons will provide some information on what we provide to make your time at Aberystwyth university an unforgetable experience.
